name: Titanium.UI.iPhone
doc:
@platform iphone 0.8 @platform ipad 0.8 @editurl https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/edit/master/apidoc/Titanium/UI/iPhone/iPhone.yml

The iPhone/iPad-specific UI capabilities. All properties, methods and events in this namespace will only work on Apple iOS systems.

property.name: MODAL_PRESENTATION_CURRENT_CONTEXT
property.doc:
View presented with the same style as its parent window.

Requires: iOS 3.2 and later

@description

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.open and Titanium.UI.Window.close methods.

One of the group of modal window presentation style constants MODAL_PRESENTATION_CURRENT_CONTEXT, MODAL_PRESENTATION_FORMSHEET, MODAL_PRESENTATION_FULLSCREEN, and MODAL_PRESENTATION_PAGESHEET.
property.shortDoc: View presented with the same style as its parent window. ...

property.name: MODAL_PRESENTATION_FORMSHEET
property.doc:
Window width and height are smaller than those of the screen and the view is centered on the screen.

Requires: iOS 3.2 and later

@description

If the system is in a landscape orientation and the keyboard is visible, the position of the view is adjusted upward so that the view remains visible. All uncovered areas are dimmed and do not respond to touch to prevent the user from interacting with them.

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.open and Titanium.UI.Window.close methods.

One of the group of modal window presentation style constants MODAL_PRESENTATION_CURRENT_CONTEXT, MODAL_PRESENTATION_FORMSHEET, MODAL_PRESENTATION_FULLSCREEN, and MODAL_PRESENTATION_PAGESHEET.
property.shortDoc:
Window width and height are smaller than those of the screen and the view is centered on
the screen. ...

property.name: MODAL_PRESENTATION_FULLSCREEN
property.doc:
Window covers the screen.

Requires: iOS 3.2 and later

@description

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.open and Titanium.UI.Window.close methods.

One of the group of modal window presentation style constants MODAL_PRESENTATION_CURRENT_CONTEXT, MODAL_PRESENTATION_FORMSHEET, MODAL_PRESENTATION_FULLSCREEN, and MODAL_PRESENTATION_PAGESHEET.

property.name: MODAL_PRESENTATION_PAGESHEET
property.doc:
Window height is the height of the screen and width is equal to screen width in a portrait orientation.

Requires: iOS 3.2 and later

@description

Any uncovered areas are dimmed and do not respond to touch, to prevent the user from interacting with them. In portrait orientations, this option is essentially the same as MODAL_PRESENTATION_FULLSCREEN.

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.open and Titanium.UI.Window.close methods.

One of the group of modal window presentation style constants MODAL_PRESENTATION_CURRENT_CONTEXT, MODAL_PRESENTATION_FORMSHEET, MODAL_PRESENTATION_FULLSCREEN, and MODAL_PRESENTATION_PAGESHEET.
property.shortDoc:
Window height is the height of the screen and width is equal to screen width in a portrait
orientation. ...

property.name: MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_COVER_VERTICAL
property.doc:
When the window is presented, its view slides up from the bottom of the screen. On dismissal, the view slides back down (default.)

Requires: iOS 3.2 and later

@description

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.open and Titanium.UI.Window.close methods.

One of the group of modal window transition style constants MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_COVER_VERTICAL, MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_CROSS_DISSOLVE, MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_FLIP_HORIZONTAL, and MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_PARTIAL_CURL.
property.shortDoc: When the window is presented, its view slides up from the bottom of the screen. ...

property.name: MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_CROSS_DISSOLVE
property.doc:
When the window is presented, the current view fades out while the new view fades in at the same time. On dismissal, a similar type of cross-fade is used to return to the original view.

Requires: iOS 3.2 and later

@description

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.open and Titanium.UI.Window.close methods.

One of the group of modal window transition style constants MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_COVER_VERTICAL, MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_CROSS_DISSOLVE, MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_FLIP_HORIZONTAL, and MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_PARTIAL_CURL.
property.shortDoc:
When the window is presented, the current view fades out while the new view fades in at the
same time. ...

property.name: MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_FLIP_HORIZONTAL
property.doc:
When the window is presented, the current view initiates a horizontal 3D flip from right-to-left, resulting in the revealing of the new view as if it were on the back of the previous view. On dismissal, the flip occurs from left-to-right, returning to the original view.

Requires: iOS 3.2 and later

@description

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.open and Titanium.UI.Window.close methods.

One of the group of modal window transition style constants MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_COVER_VERTICAL, MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_CROSS_DISSOLVE, MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_FLIP_HORIZONTAL, and MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_PARTIAL_CURL.
property.shortDoc:
When the window is presented, the current view initiates a horizontal 3D flip from
right-to-left, resulting in the re...

property.name: MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_PARTIAL_CURL
property.doc:
When the window is presented, one corner of the current view curls up to reveal the modal view underneath. On dismissal, the curled up page unfurls itself back on top of the modal view.

Requires: iOS 3.2 and later

@description

A modal view presented using this transition is itself prevented from presenting any additional modal views. This transition style is supported only if the window is presenting a MODAL_PRESENTATION_FULLSCREEN modal presentation style.

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.open and Titanium.UI.Window.close methods.

One of the group of modal window transition style constants MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_COVER_VERTICAL, MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_CROSS_DISSOLVE, MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_FLIP_HORIZONTAL, and MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_PARTIAL_CURL.
property.shortDoc:
When the window is presented, one corner of the current view curls up to reveal the modal
view underneath. ...

property.name: apiName
property.doc:
The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to.

@description

The value of this property is the fully qualified name of the API. For example, Button returns Ti.UI.Button.

@platform android 3.2.0 @platform blackberry 3.2.0 @platform iphone 3.2.0 @platform ipad 3.2.0 @platform mobileweb 3.2.0
property.shortDoc: The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to. ...

property.name: appBadge
property.doc: Value of the badge for the application's springboard icon.

property.name: appSupportsShakeToEdit
property.doc: Determines whether the shake to edit system-wide capability is enabled.

property.name: bubbleParent
property.doc:
Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent.

@description

Some proxies (most commonly views) have a relationship to other proxies, often established by the add() method. For example, for a button added to a window, a click event on the button would bubble up to the window. Other common parents are table sections to their rows, table views to their sections, and scrollable views to their views. Set this property to false to disable the bubbling to the proxy's parent.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0
property.shortDoc: Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent. ...

property.name: lifecycleContainer
property.doc:
The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy.

@description

If this property is set to a Window or TabGroup, then the corresponding Activity lifecycle event callbacks will also be called on the proxy. Proxies that require the activity lifecycle will need this property set to the appropriate containing Window or TabGroup.

@platform android 3.6.0
property.shortDoc: The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy. ...

property.name: statusBarHidden
property.doc:
Determines whether the status bar is hidden.

@description

The setter for this property does not work on iOS 7 and is deprecated for earlier iOS versions since Release 3.1.3. Use the fullscreen property of the window to control if the staus bar is shown or not.
property.shortDoc: Determines whether the status bar is hidden. ...

property.name: statusBarStyle
property.doc:
Determines the status bar color style.

@description

The setter for this property does not work on iOS 7 and is deprecated for earlier iOS versions since Release 3.1.3. Use the statusBarStyle property of the window to control the status bar style.

This API can be assigned the following constants:

  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.StatusBar.DEFAULT
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.StatusBar.GRAY
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.StatusBar.GREY
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.StatusBar.LIGHT_CONTENT
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.StatusBar.OPAQUE_BLACK
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.StatusBar.TRANSLUCENT_BLACK
property.shortDoc: Determines the status bar color style. ...

method.name: addEventListener
method.doc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to invoke when the event is fired.

method.shortDoc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...

method.name: applyProperties
method.doc:
Applies the properties to the proxy.

@description

Properties are supplied as a dictionary. Each key-value pair in the object is applied to the proxy such that myproxy[key] = value.

params.name: props
params.doc:
A dictionary of properties to apply.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform blackberry 3.3.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0 @platform mobileweb 3.0.0

method.shortDoc: Applies the properties to the proxy. ...

method.name: createNavigationGroup
method.doc: Creates and returns an instance of Titanium.UI.iPhone.NavigationGroup.

params.name: parameters
params.doc: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Titanium.UI.iPhone.NavigationGroup except those marked not-creation or read-only.

removed.text: This class is now deprecated. Please use the <Titanium.UI.iOS.NavigationWindow> class instead.

method.shortDoc: Creates and returns an instance of Titanium.UI.iPhone.NavigationGroup. ...

html_meta.removed:
This method has been removed since 3.2.0

This class is now deprecated. Please use the <Titanium.UI.iOS.NavigationWindow> class instead.

property of the window to control if the staus bar is shown or not.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.doc:
Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

@description

Multiple listeners can be registered for the same event, so the callback parameter is used to determine which listener to remove.

When adding a listener, you must save a reference to the callback function in order to remove the listener later:

var listener = function() { Ti.API.info("Event listener called."); }
window.addEventListener('click', listener);

To remove the listener, pass in a reference to the callback function:

window.removeEventListener('click', listener);

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to remove. Must be the same function passed to addEventListener.

method.shortDoc: Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...
